plants.name: Rosa rubiginosa
plants.description: A species of wild rose known for its fragrant leaves and pale pink flowers, native to Europe and western Asia. It blooms profusely in late spring to early summer.
plants.location: Europe, Western Asia, and widely naturalized elsewhere
plants.funFact: The leaves of Sweet Briar Rose emit a pleasant apple-like fragrance when crushed, due to the presence of abundant glandular hairs.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A perennial plant with tall spikes of colorful flowers, commonly found in North Americaâ€™s temperate zones. Its vibrant blooms attract a range of pollinators during late spring and early summer.
plants.funFact: Lupines are nitrogen-fixing plants that help improve soil fertility by converting atmospheric nitrogen into forms usable by plants.

plants.name: Erythronium americanum
plants.description: A woodland wildflower native to eastern North America, named for its mottled leaves resembling a troutâ€™s skin. It flowers in early to mid-spring, often by early June in cooler climates.
plants.funFact: Yellow Trout Lily forms large clonal colonies through underground bulbs, but the plants rarely flower every year.

plants.name: Jacaranda mimosifolia
plants.description: A fast-growing tree known for its spectacular display of tubular, bright violet-blue flowers that cover the tree in late spring to early summer.
plants.location: Native to South America; widely cultivated in subtropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Jacaranda trees can live up to 50 years and are widely admired for their ornamental beauty in cities like Pretoria, South Africa, and Sydney, Australia.
